basics.name: Gage Neumaier
basics.label: Aspiring IT Support Technician
basics.summary: Aspiring IT Support Technician with a strong foundation in troubleshooting, system administration, and network support through home lab experience, certifications, and hands-on training. Passionate about helping users solve technical issues while continuously expanding knowledge in Windows, Linux, networking, and cybersecurity. Adept at translating complex technical problems into simple solutions and committed to providing excellent customer service. Eager to bring problem-solving skills, technical knowledge, and a proactive mindset to a professional IT environment.

courses.summary: Completed intensive training focused on system security, user access management, and network troubleshooting. Developed hands-on experience with Windows administration tools, threat identification, and incident response—skills directly applicable to supporting end users and maintaining secure IT environments.

Built a strong foundation in analytical thinking and problem-solving through programming, systems analysis, and structured data handling. Courses in operating systems and machine organization provided technical insights relevant to diagnosing and resolving hardware/software issues.

certificates.title: CompTIA Security+
certificates.summary: Validated knowledge of core cybersecurity skills including threat analysis, risk management, incident response, and security architecture.

skills.name: Security Operations & Threat Monitoring
keywords.summary: Provides the ability to monitor and investigate alerts, logs, and suspicious activity—skills useful for identifying system issues and escalating incidents appropriately in help desk environments.

skills.name: Network Security & Protocols
keywords.summary: Strong understanding of core networking concepts and troubleshooting tools, essential for diagnosing connectivity issues and supporting remote access or DNS/DHCP-related user problems.

skills.name: Operating Systems
keywords.summary: Comfortable working across Windows, Linux, and Unix environments to manage users, perform routine maintenance, and troubleshoot system-level issues faced by end users.

skills.name: Digital Forensics & Incident Handling
keywords.summary: Capable of examining logs and endpoint data to identify root causes of issues, useful for diagnosing malware infections, login failures, or unauthorized access.

skills.name: Programming & Automation
keywords.summary: Uses scripting to automate repetitive tasks, parse logs, and support system diagnostics—enhancing efficiency in resolving tickets and improving service desk workflows.

skills.name: Cloud Security & Virtualization
keywords.summary: Basic experience securing cloud environments and virtual machines, applicable to help desk tasks like managing virtual desktops or applying security configurations.
